image.altText: a black and blotchy graphic of Kamala Harris in front of an illuminati pyramid

props.synopsis: Only minutes after US Vice-President Kamala Harris announced she would run for president, deeply offensive false narratives about her began to resurface.

title.children: These are the major false narratives that will try to convince Americans Kamala Harris isn't fit for office

image.altText: Kamala Harris in suit pointes behind a podium with flags behind her

props.synopsis: US Vice-President Kamala Harris says she has secured the broad support needed to become the Democratic Party's nominee for the upcoming presidential election. Follow live.

title.children: Kamala Harris says she has secured the broad support needed to become the Democratic Party's nominee

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Kamala Harris says she has secured broad support needed to become party's nominee
CNN and AP: Harris backed by enough delegates to claim nomination
JD Vance says Harris is a 'million times worse than Biden'

image.altText: graphic of folder with sale icon

props.synopsis: Cybersecurity experts have found advertisements claiming to re-sell highly sensitive data of millions of Australians, stolen from eScripts provider MediSecure, on the dark web, and now it's half price.

title.children: Cybercriminals are selling the sensitive data of almost 13 million Australians — for just $25,000

image.altText: Two Chinese flags flutter in the wind at a shipping port.

props.synopsis: Australia has done exceptionally well riding the boom in the Chinese economy. But the political and economic uncertainty surrounding the world's two biggest economies — the US and China — points to tougher times ahead.

title.children: While all eyes are on Washington, Beijing is quietly heading into economic oblivion

image.altText: A man speaks into a microphone

props.synopsis: Joe Biden, who walked the halls of power for half a century, built a career on relationships. But in the end, it was his decision alone to do something no president had done before.

title.children: Biden held firm against a Democratic rebellion. Then his old political allies stepped in

image.altText: Kamala Harris close-up at the White House

props.synopsis: As Democrats rally behind Kamala Harris as their best presidential hope, the vice-president hits the campaign trail, comparing her background as a criminal prosecutor to Donald Trump's trouble in the courts.

title.children: 'I know Donald Trump's type': Harris draws on prosecutor past in preview of likely campaign strategy

image.altText: A young woman with pink dies hair.

props.synopsis: Kiesha Thompson, 23, had just dropped her daughter at daycare when she was hit, and died in hospital that night.

title.children: Police allege man charged with murder helped plot alleged hit-and-run of former partner with girlfriend

image.altText: A close-up portrait photograph of Katrina Chivell.

props.synopsis: National Disability Insurance Scheme provider Katrina Chivell denies any wrongdoing, after allegations from a former client and two former workers that she overcharged the NDIS by roughly $300,000.

title.children: 'Can't get my head around it': NDIS participant and workers blow whistle on alleged $300k overcharge by provider

image.altText: Kamala Harris laughs on stage with a microphone in a blue blazer

props.synopsis: A lot has happened in US politics lately, so we don't blame you for not keeping up with the memes. Here's your guide to the biggest references surrounding Kamala Harris, starting with that infamous coconut tree.

title.children: Explaining the biggest Kamala Harris memes, from coconut trees to 'Momala' and Veep

image.altText: Two boys smiling at their dad as the dad embraces his wife with the ocean in the background.

props.synopsis: Stella Assange shares the first photo of the WikiLeaks founder and their children since his release from a British jail last month.

title.children: Julian Assange's wife shares first family photo since husband's release from prison

image.altText: A white small plane sits on the tarmac with a red carpet leading to its door.

props.synopsis: As some company CEOs are receiving a salary more than 50 times higher than the average employee's, even the rich are starting to say it's time to rein in their wealth.

title.children: As everyday people struggle with the cost of living, this group of millionaires is begging to pay more tax

image.altText: An officer leans against an ambulance with a kayak in the foreground

props.synopsis: Emergency services are treating a 20-year-old man for a leg injury after a reported shark attack at North Shore Beach,  Port Macquarie.

title.children: Man in critical condition after reported shark attack in northern NSW

image.altText: China's president Xi Jinping speaks.

props.synopsis: A deal with the Philippines on the South China Sea reflects a longstanding balancing act by China, but the broader outlook reveals the regional power could be changing its tone on big issues.

title.children: Xi softens stance in South China Sea amid troubled economy and new reform blueprint

image.altText: A mobile phone is held in a person's hand at the ASX in Sydney

props.synopsis: The ASX has started the day's trade on the rise while overnight the prices for gold, oil and copper took a dive. Follow live.

title.children: Rental relief as Australia's asking prices stabilise, while CrowdStrike shares slip further

image.altText: Construction at a school in Tasmania.

props.synopsis: The continued exhumation of a former cemetery on the grounds of a prestigious Hobart boys' school has uncovered an additional 1,300 human remains.

title.children: Human remains found during excavation for new Hobart school building now top 1,300

image.altText: Man smiling at camera

props.synopsis: Prominent anti-whaling campaigner and veteran environmental activist Paul Watson has been detained on an Interpol Red Notice in Greenland.

title.children: Anti-whaling campaigner Paul Watson arrested in Greenland

image.altText: A composite image of Mary Fowler, Lauren Jackson and Charlotte Caslick.

props.synopsis: Ten teams across six sports will represent Australia at the Paris Olympic Games, and many of them have genuine hopes of taking a medal home with them.

title.children: From the Matildas to the Gangurrus — everything you need to know about the Aussie teams bidding for gold in Paris

image.altText: A hiker stands atop a mountain ridge and looks over at other peaks.

props.synopsis: A rescue helicopter is helping to search for an "experienced" bushwalker who failed to check in with friends over the weekend after a challenging Tasmanian hike.

title.children: Bushwalker missing on challenging Tasmanian hike after failing to make contact with friends

image.altText: A boy and his dad smiling together while on a mountain.

props.synopsis: SA Health says it is still months away from completing an investigation into a potential privacy breach involving a patient ABC News understands to be Charlie Stevens, the son of the SA Police commissioner.

title.children: Investigation into Charlie Stevens's medical records breach to take months

image.altText: AFL player Sam Ried clenches his fist in celebration on the footy field after kicking a goal

props.synopsis: Sam Reid, one of the last remaining members of the Sydney Swans' 2012 grand final winning team, has retired from the AFL.

title.children: Swans premiership player announces retirement after multiple injury setbacks

image.altText: A mother and her baby at the playground. The baby is in the swing while the mum holds her close.

props.synopsis: Even when parents don't share a surname, largely children are given their father's name. Five mothers share why passing on their name was important.

title.children: 'I was told I was selfish': The mothers giving babies their surname

image.altText: A caramel coloured mother labradoodle feeding her puppies.

props.synopsis: More than 250 labradoodles have been surrendered to the RSPCA following the closure of one of Tasmania's largest dog breeders.

title.children: Hundreds of labradoodles needing a home after dog breeder shuts down

image.altText: A man in a fawn-coloured coat smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: Tasmanian Supreme Court judge Gregory Geason has faced further questions about the alleged assault of a woman — an allegation he denies — as a court hearing continues.

title.children: 'You don't think that's a little creepy?': Judge questioned over photos of alleged assault victim's house

image.altText: BMW plug-in hybrid charger

props.synopsis: A tax benefit has allowed Australians to save tens of thousands of dollars when buying plug-in hybrid cars but the motor industry warns that is set to end next year and it could slow sales and undermine emissions reduction efforts.

title.children: Plug-in hybrid car sales have surged but an expiring tax discount could soon end the party

image.altText: An explosion goes off in the middle of a landscape dotted with a few shrubs

props.synopsis: Feral cats continue to plague Australia, costing farmers billions and pushing native animals to extinction. Researchers say to solve the problem, we should change tack and target one of their main food sources — rabbits.

title.children: Rabbit warren 'ripping' might be the way to win the war on feral cats, researchers hope

image.altText: Houses under construction on a bright, sunny day

props.synopsis: A new study has predicted that all properties in Greater Sydney will continue to be unaffordable for those earning a median income until at least the end of 2031.

title.children: On an average wage? You may need to wait until the 2030s to afford to buy a home in Sydney

image.altText: a young queer couple in disagreement on a couch, a scene from the series Couples Therapy

props.synopsis: Dr Orna Guralnik guides three couples and one three-person polycule through arguments over infidelity, intimacy and of course who's going to do the dishes, in the latest season of Couples Therapy.

title.children: Is the Couples Therapy docuseries pure voyeurism? Is that even ethical? A guide to the new season

image.altText: Kimberly Cheatle sits behind a wooden desk and microphone speaking to people out of shot

props.synopsis: Kimberly Cheatle told a congressional committee hearing that she takes full responsibility for the missteps of the Secret Service in the lead-up to the attempt on Donald Trump's life.

title.children: 'We failed': Secret Service chief grilled over Donald Trump assassination attempt

image.altText: Before and after imagery shows widespread damage to trees and buildings.

props.synopsis: Satellite imagery has revealed the extent of damage to the Gaza War Cemetery at Deir El Belah, which is mainly dedicated to fallen Allied personnel, including more than 250 Australians.

title.children: Australian war graves in historic Gaza cemetery feared damaged or destroyed following Israel's invasion

image.altText: A man and three children stand in front of the ruins of a building

props.synopsis: The Israeli military attacks the city of Khan Younis, which it designated a humanitarian zone, moments after ordering an evacuation of the area to take out Hamas targets.

title.children: At least 70 Palestinians killed in humanitarian zone near Khan Younis after Israel orders evacuation

image.altText: A still from The Sloth Lane, showing an animated character smiling.

props.synopsis: "Creative hurricanes" Kristen Souvlis and Nadine Bates might be Queensland's best-kept secret, with the duo raking in awards for their popular kids' movies.

title.children: Can't get enough of Bluey? These Queensland animators are giving the popular Heeler family a run for their money
